alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 4:44PM MDT until June 12 at 11:58AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Colorado... North Fork Big Thompson River at Drake affecting Larimer County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...North Fork Big Thompson River at Drake. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 4.5 feet, Water overflows banks in the lowest areas adjacent to the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 4.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady below flood stage at 4.7 feet. Lowland flooding is expected. - Action stage is 4.5 feet. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
